channel.title: Type of Server
channel.description:
A lot of people talk about what kind of server to get into. Some people think they should make a server where you level quickly and it has a lot of custom items. That type server usually brings in a crowd but then the people usually quit very quickly. The other type, is a well thought out server with slow-medium leveling and few to no custom items. Generally, the second one comes out on top. It may seem like the other way is better, but really are you going to keep the players from it? Some of my players are still with me and I've run the server for 2 years.
I'd just like to have everyones opinions on this.

item.title: Type of Server
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Economy = good.
Good pking = good.

Without that then people will leave after about 4 days.

Read full topic

item.title: Type of Server
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Slow with few customs.

Read full topic

item.title: Type of Server
item.dc:creator: @sexy_slay sexy slay
item.description:
@sexy_slay wrote:

i prefer slow hard working and no costums. I try to make the players feel like they have to try to be something on my server. Also it makes it a little more realistic, and for me alot of fun.

Read full topic

item.title: Type of Server
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

r0ckstar96:

let it have a good economy. By that I mean, slow leveling but not as slow as RS, no customs, possibly just have a simple silab server with all working levels if you can, low lag, etc.

No.

[quote=“cocoa, post:13, topic:299642”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=395948.msg2941525#msg2941525 date=1251921135]

I’ve been hosting a server for ~2 years without a VPS 100% uptime from my comp, so really no loss m8.

Well for you its ok, but remember you do not pay for internets and electricity.

Out of curiosity, can you give some specs of your server. (and where do you keep it?)
[/quote]

I keep it on my desk.[/quote]

if you have been hosting for about 2 years wow, i should start hosting, my HP laptop has 3gb of ram and 2.1ghz, that’s epic :o

Read full topic

item.title: Type of Server
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:1, topic:299642”]A lot of people talk about what kind of server to get into. Some people think they should make a server where you level quickly and it has a lot of custom items. That type server usually brings in a crowd but then the people usually quit very quickly. The other type, is a well thought out server with slow-medium leveling and few to no custom items. Generally, the second one comes out on top. It may seem like the other way is better, but really are you going to keep the players from it? Some of my players are still with me and I’ve run the server for 2 years.

I’d just like to have everyones opinions on this.[/quote]
I think you should make a server that transfers data at 5GB/s to my computer so I can basically use it as a harddrive. YESH! (Servers don’t have to be related to RuneScape now do they?)

Read full topic

item.title: Type of Server
item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

Medium leveling, hard pvp drops, strong econamy, items gained only from pvp drops, risky area’s = more chance of better loot etc.

^ rapage

item.title: Type of Server
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

It’s annoying if a server has loads of customs, as you can’t test it without downloading another client.

Read full topic

item.title: Type of Server
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:4, topic:299642”]The fact is, if you own a decent sever (physical machine) or rent one then ofc it is worth it to make training slow enough for people to play for at least a month. You normally run this type of sever when you want to make some money from membership, items etc. (this normally ends in a loss because of vps costs)

But if you just want to have some fun for yourself or with some friends, really short training and pking all the time is brilliant. I used to host a server for about 3 hours for teh lulz.[/quote]
I’ve been hosting a server for ~2 years without a VPS 100% uptime from my comp, so really no loss m8.

Read full topic
